summary: Adds some robing rooms, for the player, in Jarl's abodes around Skyrim.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/UJ12AJk.png[/img][/center]
[center][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/65163/?][img]http://i.imgur.com/QtD7v94.png[/img][/url][/center]


This mod was a request for some robing rooms of sorts in Jarl's abodes, where the player could change into a fancy attire instead of going to say hello to the authorities covered in Bandit guts and blood.

The rooms are quite small, but there should be room for the player and maybe one follower. If you are traipsing about with 10 people, you should probably ask them to wait for you outside. And mostly as an experiment, I used Grimoa's fine painting frame resources to try and make a couple of mirrors. They are basically just paintings, so you won't actually see yourself, but I think they add a nice touch.

Here is the list of buildings with changing rooms:
01- The White Hall (Dawnstar)
02- Jarl's Longhouse (Falkreath)
03- Understone Keep (Markarth)
04- Blue Palace (Morthal)
05- Mistveil Keep (Riften)
06- Blue Palace (Solitude)
07- Dragonsreach (Whiterun)
08- Palace of the Kings (Windhelm)
09- Jarl's Longhouse (Winterhold)

When you enter any of these buildings, look to your left, and you'll see the trapdoors. Since I am making changes to the interiors (even if it's just a trapdoor), this mod will probably not be compatible with other mods that make changes to the Jarls' dwellings.

To install, place the files in your 'SteamSteamAppsCommonSkyrimData' folder. Then activate the mod through your preferred launcher by ticking the checkbox next to the esp.

Now, for the credits:
- Painting frame resource by [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/10963/]Grimoa[/url]
- Mirror texture by [url=http://rcdezine.deviantart.com/art/Glass-Texture-350473344]RCDezine[/url]
- Wood texture from [url=http://wallpoper.com/wallpaper/wood-textures-248249]Walloper[/url]


[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/UJ12AJk.png[/img][/center]
author: Jokerine
